TopicTitle: external command seat is not controlling the vessal

Articles.Content: I made a small plane with external seats rather than pods. When a kerbal boards the seat the plane does not become controllable. Did I attach the seat incorrectly (it's attached radially to a girder)? Are those seats designed to hold passengers rather than pilots?
It should work even the way you've described it. Without a probe core or command pod, you won't be able to use SAS or FAR flight assistance, but it definitely works:
Are you sure your not missing something else? The command seat does not have built in SAS if that's what you mean by "controllable".
I believe you still need a probe-core to make this work.

here's a screenshot of the thing. Brakes and gear work (I did forget batteries first time around), but throttle or staging don't work. Right clicking on the kerbal shows EVA information but I assume that's correct. The navball indicates the orientation of the seat (horizon, eastward).
